prompt: Evaluate how managerial accounting contributes to internal decision-making and organizational strategy.

criteria.name: Understanding of Managerial Accounting Tools
criteria.description: Demonstrates knowledge of tools such as CVP analysis, budgeting, and forecasting.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Comprehensively explains multiple tools and their strategic use in decision-making.
performance_descriptors.good: Accurately describes 2â€“3 tools with some insight into usage.
performance_descriptors.average: Mentions tools but provides limited explanation or depth.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Basic or unclear understanding of tools.
performance_descriptors.poor: Fails to describe managerial accounting tools.

criteria.name: Application to Strategic Decision-Making
criteria.description: Analyzes how managerial accounting supports internal planning and long-term strategy.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Insightfully connects accounting tools to real business planning and strategy.
performance_descriptors.good: Explains general planning support with moderate clarity.
performance_descriptors.average: Touches on planning relevance but lacks depth.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Minimal link between accounting tools and strategy.
performance_descriptors.poor: No discussion of decision-making or strategy.

criteria.name: Evaluation of Impact Under Uncertainty
criteria.description: Evaluates the role of accounting data in uncertain business environments.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Critically assesses how data-driven decisions mitigate uncertainty.
performance_descriptors.good: Explains the importance of accounting data in uncertain scenarios.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Minimal understanding of uncertainty in decisions.
performance_descriptors.poor: No discussion of uncertainty or risk.

criteria.name: Structure and Academic Style
criteria.description: Presents arguments in a formal tone with clear logical flow.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Highly coherent essay with formal style and strong structure.
performance_descriptors.good: Mostly well-organized and academic in tone.

key_points: Define managerial accounting and distinguish it from financial accounting.
Explain how CVP analysis aids short-term decision-making and pricing.
Demonstrate how budgeting and forecasting inform resource allocation and strategy.
Evaluate break-even analysis in planning and cost control.
Analyze how accounting supports decision-making under uncertainty using variance analysis and sensitivity models.
llm_questions: What is managerial accounting and how is it different from financial accounting?
How does cost-volume-profit analysis help businesses in setting prices and predicting profits?
What are the benefits of budgeting and forecasting in strategic planning?
Can you explain how break-even analysis informs business decisions?
How does managerial accounting assist in decision-making under uncertainty?
What is variance analysis and how is it used to control performance?
How do organizations use accounting data to make long-term strategic choices?
